intro: Pentas purpurea subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple pentas, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in cymes at the ends of the branches. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm climates.
